attributes.action: CONDUCT A PUBLIC INQUIRY into why senior NHS managers are protected from the consequences of their actions, even when they break the law.
attributes.additional_details:
The upper case lettering indicates what action we want you to take - you seem to be unable to identify this on so many occasions!

Recent cases have shown, even more, that NHS managers are being allowed, by the Department of Health, to run roughshod over the laws of this land when it comes to dealing with whistleblowers who they spend MILLIONS of taxpayer pounds trying unlawfully, to gag. The Department of Health MUST be brought into line and MUST be required to hold senior NHS managers legally and personally financially  responsible for their unlawful actions.
